column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I particularly loved Hopper's work
column2: because his ability to take the seemingly typical and mundane
column3: and turn it into a special
column4: poignant observation is truly a gift. Many of the people in his works are expressionless
column6: you can't help feel reactive towards his characters. You want to give them feeling that you can see
column7: but that's what is so special. The way the light creates shapes in an empty room
column8: the interaction between two people in a diner
column9: a lighthouse from three different perspectives on a hill--these are all effortless
